verses.verse: Listen,<WH8085> O isles,<WH339> to me; and listen,<WH7181> you people,<WH3816> from far;<WH7350> The LORD<WH3068> has called<WH7121> me from the womb;<WH990> from the bowels<WH4578> of my mother<WH517> has he made mention<WH2142> of my name.<WH8034>

And he has made<WH7760> my mouth<WH6310> like a sharp<WH2299> sword;<WH2719> in the shadow<WH6738> of his hand<WH3027> has he hid<WH2244> me, and made<WH7760> me a polished<WH1305> shaft;<WH2671> in his quiver<WH827> has he hid<WH5641> me;
And said<WH559> to me, You are my servant,<WH5650> O Israel,<WH3478> in whom<WH834> I will be glorified.<WH6286>

Then I said,<WH559> I have labored<WH3021> in vain,<WH7385> I have spent<WH3615> my strength<WH3581> for nothing,<WH8414> and in vain:<WH1892> yet surely<WH403> my judgment<WH4941> is with the LORD,<WH3068> and my work<WH6468> with my God.<WH430>

And now,<WH6258> said<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> that formed<WH3335> me from the womb<WH990> to be his servant,<WH5650> to bring<WH7725> Jacob<WH3290> again<WH7725> to him, Though Israel<WH3478> be not gathered,<WH622> yet shall I be glorious<WH3513> in the eyes<WH5869> of the LORD,<WH3068> and my God<WH430> shall be my strength.<WH5797>

And he said,<WH559> It is a light<WH7043> thing that you should be my servant<WH5650> to raise<WH6965> up the tribes<WH7626> of Jacob,<WH3290> and to restore<WH7725> the preserved<WH5336> of Israel:<WH3478> I will also give<WH5414> you for a light<WH216> to the Gentiles,<WH1471> that you may be my salvation<WH3444> to the end<WH7097> of the earth.<WH776>

Thus<WH3541> said<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> the Redeemer<WH1350> of Israel,<WH3478> and his Holy<WH6918> One, to him whom man<WH5315> despises,<WH960> to him whom the nation<WH1471> abhors,<WH8581> to a servant<WH5650> of rulers,<WH4910> Kings<WH4428> shall see<WH7200> and arise,<WH6965> princes<WH8269> also shall worship,<WH7812> because<WH4616> of the LORD<WH3068> that is faithful,<WH539> and the Holy<WH6918> One of Israel,<WH3478> and he shall choose<WH977> you.

Thus<WH3541> said<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> In an acceptable<WH7522> time<WH6256> have I heard<WH6030> you, and in a day<WH3117> of salvation<WH3444> have I helped<WH5826> you: and I will preserve<WH5341> you, and give<WH5414> you for a covenant<WH1285> of the people,<WH5971> to establish<WH6965> the earth,<WH776> to cause to inherit<WH5157> the desolate<WH8076> heritages;<WH5159>

That you may say<WH559> to the prisoners,<WH631> Go<WH3318> forth;<WH3318> to them that are in darkness,<WH2822> Show<WH1540> yourselves. They shall feed<WH7462> in the ways,<WH1870> and their pastures<WH4830> shall be in all<WH3605> high<WH8205> places.

They shall not hunger<WH7456> nor<WH3808> thirst;<WH6770> neither<WH3808> shall the heat<WH8273> nor<WH3808> sun<WH8121> smite<WH5221> them: for he that has mercy<WH7355> on them shall lead<WH5090> them, even by the springs<WH4002> of water<WH4325> shall he guide<WH5095> them.
And I will make<WH7760> all<WH3605> my mountains<WH2022> a way,<WH1870> and my highways<WH4546> shall be exalted.<WH7311>

Behold,<WH2009> these<WH428> shall come<WH935> from far:<WH7350> and, see,<WH2009> these<WH428> from the north<WH6828> and from the west;<WH3220> and these<WH428> from the land<WH776> of Sinim.<WH5515>

Sing,<WH7442> O heavens;<WH8064> and be joyful,<WH1523> O earth;<WH776> and break<WH6476> forth into singing,<WH7440> O mountains:<WH2022> for the LORD<WH3068> has comforted<WH5162> his people,<WH5971> and will have mercy<WH7355> on his afflicted.<WH6041>
But Zion<WH6726> said,<WH559> The LORD<WH3068> has forsaken<WH5800> me, and my Lord<WH136> has forgotten<WH7913> me.

Can a woman<WH802> forget<WH7911> her sucking<WH5764> child, that she should not have compassion<WH7355> on the son<WH1121> of her womb?<WH990> yes,<WH1571> they may forget,<WH7911> yet will I not forget<WH7911> you.
Behold,<WH2005> I have graven<WH2710> you on the palms<WH3709> of my hands;<WH3709> your walls<WH2346> are continually<WH8548> before<WH5048> me.
Your children<WH1121> shall make haste;<WH4116> your destroyers<WH2040> and they that made you waste<WH2717> shall go<WH3318> forth<WH3318> of you.

Lift<WH5375> up your eyes<WH5869> round<WH5439> about, and behold:<WH7200> all<WH3605> these gather<WH6908> themselves together, and come<WH935> to you. As I live,<WH2416> said<WH5002> the LORD,<WH3068> you shall surely<WH3588> clothe<WH3847> you with them all,<WH3605> as with an ornament,<WH5716> and bind<WH7194> them on you, as a bride<WH3618> does.

For your waste<WH2723> and your desolate<WH8074> places, and the land<WH776> of your destruction,<WH2035> shall even<WH3588> now<WH6258> be too narrow<WH3334> by reason of the inhabitants,<WH3427> and they that swallowed<WH1104> you up shall be far<WH7368> away.

The children<WH1121> which you shall have, after you have lost<WH7923> the other, shall say<WH559> again<WH5750> in your ears,<WH241> The place<WH4725> is too strait<WH6862> for me: give<WH5066> place<WH4725> to me that I may dwell.<WH3427>

Then shall you say<WH559> in your heart,<WH3824> Who<WH4310> has begotten<WH3205> me these,<WH428> seeing I have lost<WH7908> my children, and am desolate,<WH1565> a captive,<WH1473> and removing<WH5493> to and fro? and who<WH4310> has brought<WH1431> up these?<WH2004> Behold,<WH2005> I was left<WH7604> alone;<WH905> these,<WH428> where<WH375> had they been?

Thus<WH3541> said<WH559> the Lord<WH136> GOD,<WH3069> Behold,<WH2009> I will lift<WH5375> up my hand<WH3027> to the Gentiles,<WH1471> and set<WH7311> up my standard<WH5251> to the people:<WH5971> and they shall bring<WH935> your sons<WH1121> in their arms,<WH2684> and your daughters<WH1323> shall be carried<WH5375> on their shoulders.<WH3802>

And kings<WH4428> shall be your nursing<WH539> fathers, and their queens<WH8282> your nursing<WH3243> mothers: they shall bow<WH7812> down<WH7812> to you with their face<WH639> toward the earth,<WH776> and lick<WH3897> up the dust<WH6083> of your feet;<WH7272> and you shall know<WH3045> that I am the LORD:<WH3068> for they shall not be ashamed<WH954> that wait<WH6960> for me.
Shall the prey<WH4455> be taken<WH3947> from the mighty,<WH1368> or the lawful<WH6662> captive<WH7628> delivered?<WH4422>

But thus<WH3541> said<WH559> the LORD,<WH3068> Even<WH1571> the captives<WH7628> of the mighty<WH1368> shall be taken<WH3947> away, and the prey<WH4455> of the terrible<WH6184> shall be delivered:<WH4422> for I will contend<WH7378> with him that contends<WH3401> with you, and I will save<WH3467> your children.<WH1121>

And I will feed<WH398> them that oppress<WH3238> you with their own flesh;<WH1320> and they shall be drunken<WH7937> with their own blood,<WH1818> as with sweet<WH6071> wine:<WH6071> and all<WH3605> flesh<WH1320> shall know<WH3045> that I the LORD<WH3068> am your Savior<WH3467> and your Redeemer,<WH1350> the mighty<WH46> One of Jacob.<WH3290>
